newsitem.title: JAPAN: Computer firms say agree to standardise mobile NCs.
newsitem.headline: Computer firms say agree to standardise mobile NCs.

text.p: Toshiba Corp and 10 other major computer hardware and software makers said on Monday that they had agreed to standardise specifications for mobile network computers by September.

The companies involved are Toshiba, Apple Computer Inc, International Business Machines Corp, Netscape Communications Corp, Sun Microsystems Inc, Oracle Corp's Network Computer Inc, Lotus Development Corp, Nokia Mobile Phones, Hitachi Ltd, Fujitsu Ltd and Mitsubishi Electric Corp.

The new format will be based on the Network Computer Reference Profile, an earlier blueprint of Java-based standards agreed by Apple, IBM, Sun Microsystems Netscape and Oracle in May 1996, a joint statement by the 11 firms said.

Mobile network computers are a new class of devices that range from "smart" cellular phones to lightweight, hand-held mobile devices with easy access to the Internet or corporate networks, the statement said.

The standardised specifications will determine how mobile computer screens should look, how much power they need, the method of linking them with networks and the types of peripheral devices they support, it said.
